alert.note: Alert for Kent; Queen Anne's (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 9:21PM EDT until May 27 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL TALBOT...SOUTHWESTERN QUEEN ANNE`S AND SOUTHWESTERN KENT COUNTIES... At 921 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Stevensville to Talbot to near Tilghman Island, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Centerville, Talbot, Centreville, St. Michaels, Oxford, Grasonville, Tilghman Island, Stevensville, Skipton, Copperville, Chester, Overton, Starkey Corner, Wye Mills, Hambleton, Carville, Queenstown and Stevensville South. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
